cause.description:
Online bullying, called cyberbullying, happens when teens use the Internet, cell phones, or other devices to send or post text or images intended to hurt or embarrass another person. Cyberbullying is a problem affecting almost half of all American teens. Whether you’ve been a victim of cyberbullying, know someone who has been cyberbullied, or have even cyberbullied yourself, there are steps you and your friends can take to stop cyberbullying and stay cyber-safe. More information can be found at: http://www.ncpc.org/cyberbullying
1. Delete Cyberbullying
2. Don't write it
3. Don't forward it
cause.mission: To prevent cyberbullying through awareness education.
cause.name: Delete Cyberbullying
